item.description:
As part of "Art After Hours" on the first Thursday of each month, the Wadsworth Atheneum selects a movie that blends with the theme of the evening.  Come for the art, music, tour, and more - stay for the film!

"The Women on the 6th Floor" is set in 1960's Paris, when a staid couple's life is turned upside-down by a group of Spanish maids living in a flat above them.  Made in 2010 and directed by Philippe Le Guay, the movie is in French with English subtitles and runs about 104 minutes.   ﻿www.imdb.com/title/tt1805297

Movies are free with your admission to "Art After Hours", which starts at 5:00pm and costs $5 for general admission, free to members and college students with ID.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "The Women on the 6th Floor" - Art After Hours
